title: I-35E north photos Lewisville

pageHeader.title: Drivers Views, Northbound Belt Line to Lewisville
pageHeader.lastUpdated: Sept 10, 2017 (create); Sept 12, 2020 (add photos); Dec 19, 2021 (update for new $655 million contract); Sept 15, 2022 (review)

text: The first expansion project in this section was completed in late 2017. The interchange at SH 121 (Rayburn Tollway) fully opened a little later. The expansion project created two reversible HOT lanes, added collector-distributor lanes between Bush Turnpike and SH 121, and added two general purpose lanes north of SH 121. In July 2021 a $655 million contract was awarded for the second (and final) phase of work between IH-635 and Bush Turnpike.

images.caption: Between the Bush Turnpike and Rayburn Turnpike/SH 121. The collector-distributor lanes are on the right.
Approaching the interchange at the Sam Rayburn Turnpike/SH 121.
The south half (in the near foreground) of this interchange was completed in 2006, and the north half was nearing completion at the time of this photo.
The ramps on the north side of the interchange, opened in 2017, feature long elevated sections.
The following views are going southbound through the SH 121 (Rayburn Turnpike) interchange. Notice the ridiculously high toll on the toll ramp to the Rayburn Turnpike.
